info.author: Chris von Csefalvay
info.description:
===============================
growup
===============================

Growup adds the [NCoC](https://github.com/domgetter/NCoC/) to your project. Because there ain't no Code
f Conduct like No Code of Conduct!

**Disclaimer**: This project is not affiliated with NCoC or its developers. Nor does it endorse the NCoC or express an
opposition to other codes of conduct. As a developer, I think you should be trusted with knowing what code of conduct
would benefit your project most. Maybe it's the NCoC. Maybe it's the TODO Group's CoC. Maybe it's something entirely
different. *This is a tool*, and you are to use it wisely. It is *your responsibility* to know what your project needs.

Installation
============

::

    pip install growup

After this, `growup` will be available from the command line (`growup`).

Usage
=====

`growup` is a small command line utility that adds the NCoC (No Code of Conduct) to your project.

Options
-------

```
  --root TEXT             Project root directory (default: current directory)
  --add-to-contribute     Append NCoC to CONTRIBUTING or CONTRIBUTING.md (must
                          be in root dir!)
  --add-to-file           Create a separate Code of Conduct file. Define path
                          using --output-filename
  --output-filename TEXT  Output filename and extension. Default: CODEOFCONDUCT.md.
  --help                  Show this message and exit
```

Example
-------

The following call will
- add NCoC to `CONTRIBUTING.md` in the current folder, and
- also add it to a file called `CodeOfConduct.md`

```
growup --add-to-contribute --add-to-file --output-filename CodeOfConduct.md
```

License
=======

Custom BSD-based. See the [full license here](https://chrisvoncsefalvay.com/growup/master/LICENSE).

Changelog
=========


0.3.5 (2015-08-16)
-----------------------------------------

* Small tweaks :) Now uses autoinference to figure out whether it is appending to an RST document and follows RST style
if so.


0.3.3 (2015-08-11)
-----------------------------------------

* First release on PyPI.
